Chinoperla nigroflavata
– Zwick 1980: 130 (transferred from Sinoperla ). —

China : Fujian Province , known only from the (now lost) holotype .

The details of the aedeagal structures of this species are still unknown and the type material is lost ( Wu 1948 ;
Du et al. 1999
; Yang & Li 2018 ). No new material was available for the present study, but it seems to differ from the remaining Chinese species of
Chinoperla
based on the absence of the short Sc of the forewing and the shape of the dark median sclerite of tergum 9 ( Wu 1948 : figs 8–9).
Chinoperla gorohovi Sivec & Stark, 2010
from Guangdong and Vietnam is easily distinguishable from
C. nigroflavata
by the slender nail-shaped median sclerite with a slightly enlarged apex ( Fig. 11B–D ).
